result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael S Tody was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations including establishment of a driver safety plan.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant granted good time credit.
Defendant may serve sentence in Jackson County or any other county in Wisconsin.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan Policy and OWI Info
elements

A.D.A. Kurczewski appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Nielsen.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 of the information. Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant was found guilty as to Count 1.  (OWI 5th offense)
Count 2 is dismissed.
Statements by counsel.
The Court orders that sentence be withheld and places the defendant on probation for a period of 4 years, concurrent with the sentence in 16 CF 73.
See file for conditions of probation.
Appeal rights, voting and firearms restrictions were provided.

Below typed by LM
Conditions of probation:
15CF344 - $1,200.00 fine + costs 
16CF73 - pay costs
Submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate and abide by treatment recommendations
15CF344 - Submit to an alcohol and other drug abuse assessment from WCDHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by treatment recommendations including establishment of a driver safety plan
15CF344 - Jail - 6 months with good time credit
May serve sentence in Jackson County or any other county in Wisconsin
Huber/Work release per 303.08(1) granted
DL revoked 2 years with credit
IID 1 year
Granted 1/2 price IID
